taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [Greek Oread, mythological nymph of hills and mountains, alluding to alpine habitat]

bio:treatment.discussion: Oreas much resembles Cynodontium, but has a cygneous seta (when moist) and symmetric capsules. European specimens are more slender, with shorter leaves, but the differences are not significant.

references.reference: Steere, W. C. 1958. The discovery of Oreas martiana in arctic Alaska, a genus new to North America. Bryologist 61: 119–124.
Weber, W. A. 1960. A second American record for Oreas martiana, from Colorado. Bryologist 63: 241–244.
